events.description: Upcoming holidays in China affecting business activity and demand.
Copper lost nearly 4% in the session prior to Thursday.

facts.fact_text: Copper prices held below $5.85 per pound on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: Copper held below $5.85 per pound on Thursday

facts.fact_text: China's refined copper output increased by 10% last year.
Stockpiles in LME warehouses in Asia have been rising.

evidences.evidence_text: Rising stockpiles in major trading hubs, particularly LME warehouses in Asia

facts.fact_text: Purchases from Chinese fabricators and manufacturers slowed for two consecutive days as of Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: purchases from Chinese fabricators and manufacturers slowed for a second consecutive day on Wednesday

claims.claim_text: China's refined copper output is expected to rise by approximately 5% this year.
claims.author: An industry group

evidences.evidence_text: An industry group has forecasted that the country’s refined copper output will likely rise by about 5% this year

claims.claim_text: Supplies originally intended for the US might have been moved to other locations.

evidences.evidence_text: signaling that supplies initially destined for the US may have been redirected elsewhere

claims.claim_text: Dip-buying in copper faded due to selling pressure in gold and silver.

evidences.evidence_text: The dip-buying earlier this week also faded as precious metals, especially gold and silver, came under renewed selling pressure

evidence.evidence_text: weighed down rising supplies in top consumer China
Rising stockpiles in major trading hubs, particularly LME warehouses in Asia, also weighed on prices
purchases from Chinese fabricators and manufacturers slowed... as businesses prepare for the Lunar New Year holidays
The dip-buying earlier this week also faded as precious metals, especially gold and silver, came under renewed selling pressure
